intro: Tetradymia multicaulis, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often at high elevations. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with prominent white centers. Tetradymia multicaulis is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in mountainous regions of California and Nevada.
